Package adrenaline.network.rmi

Interface RmiServerInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RmiServerClientHandler
    public interface RmiServerInterface
extends java.rmi.Remote
    Interface that declares methods callable by a RMI client on a RMI server, it is the server representation uploaded on the RMI registry which clients looks up for when trying to connect

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void receiveData​(RmiClientCallbackInterface client, DataForServer data)
      Method used by RMI clients when sending some data to RMI server
      void registerClient​(RmiClientCallbackInterface client)
      Method to register a client on RMI server, clients use it passing "themselves" to create a server-side representation

    • Method Detail

      • registerClient

        void registerClient​(RmiClientCallbackInterface client)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method to register a client on RMI server, clients use it passing "themselves" to create a server-side representation
        Parameters:
        client - is the client who is connecting to RMI server
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an error occurs in the communication on the net

      • receiveData

        void receiveData​(RmiClientCallbackInterface client,
                 DataForServer data)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method used by RMI clients when sending some data to RMI server
        Parameters:
        client - is the client who is sending data
        data - is the pack of data sent
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if an error occurs in the communication on the net
